N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 800.20 - Proper care of vessel and authority to order change of berth

State Regulations
A vessel anchored or moored in the port or lying at the dock
must at all times have at least one officer and such seamen on board or in
charge thereof as will insure proper care of the vessel. If it becomes
necessary in order to facilitate navigation or the commerce of the port or for
the protection of other vessels or property, a vessel may be ordered to shift
its position at a wharf, to change berths, or to vacate a berth by order of the
commission at the expense of the owner, and owner and vessel shall be liable
for all damages and costs that arise thereby. Notes
